Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Wednesday January 8), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for wednesday, january 8th. 

in a monumental move, google has announced its intentions to invest $10 billion into india over the next five to seven years. ceo sundar pichai revealed the india digitization fund, highlighting a commitment to connectivity and digital transformation. google aims to focus on enabling affordable access, localized tools, and leveraging ai power within the region. this significant investment underlines india's growing importance in the global tech landscape and comes as competition with rival tech giants continues to intensify.

meanwhile, amazon is set to expand its operations with the addition of 5,000 new tech and corporate jobs in texas. the e-commerce behemoth plans to enhance its austin tech hub, venturing into sectors like software engineering and research science. these new roles reflect amazon's ongoing investment in innovation and technology, propelling its market reach and enhancing operational capabilities. 

in the world of social media, twitter is testing a new subscription service known as 'twitter blue'. initially rolled out in a few select markets, the service offers users premium features like undo tweet, folder organization for bookmarks, and easier access to customer support. with social platforms exploring diversified revenue streams, this new model aims to cater to power users seeking enhanced utility and experience.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for wednesday, january 8th.

in a landmark announcement, google has committed to a $10 billion investment in india over the next five to seven years. ceo sundar pichai introduced the india digitization fund, emphasizing google's dedication to boosting connectivity and fostering digital transformation in the region. the initiative focuses on making access affordable, developing localized tools, and harnessing the power of ai within india. this significant investment signals india's rising prominence in the global tech arena as competition among tech giants heats up.

meanwhile, amazon is bolstering its footprint in texas by adding 5,000 new tech and corporate positions. the e-commerce giant plans to expand its austin tech hub, delving into fields such as software engineering and research science. this expansion underscores amazon's continuous push for innovation, extending its market influence and operational prowess.

switching to social media, twitter is testing 'twitter blue,' a new subscription service debuting in select markets. this premium service offers features like undo tweet, organizing bookmarks into folders, and improved customer support access. as social platforms explore diverse revenue channels, this model seeks to appeal to power users looking for enhanced functionality and user experience.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-190 Google's $10b India Investment 🇮🇳, Amazon's Texas Expansion 🏢, Twitter Blue's New Features 💡
Podcast Description:
welcome to wall-e's tech briefing for wednesday, january 8th! dive into today's top stories:

  • google's $10 billion india investment: launch of the india digitization fund aimed at boosting connectivity and digital transformation, with a focus on affordable access and localized tools powered by ai.
  • amazon's texas expansion: 5,000 new tech and corporate jobs announced as amazon plans to expand its austin tech hub, highlighting growth in software engineering and research science sectors.
  • twitter's 'twitter blue' test: introduction of a new subscription service featuring undo tweet, bookmark folders, and enhanced customer support, targeting power users with improved functionality.

stay tuned for more tech insights tomorrow!
Image Prompt: a cohesive podcast cover image featuring a vibrant fusion of modern technology and indian culture. in the center, a large silhouette of the indian subcontinent is surrounded by glowing digital networks and circuit patterns, symbolizing google's substantial investment in india. to the left, a sleek architectural structure represents amazon's significant expansion in texas, showcased by a blending of traditional texan elements like subtle cowboy boots etched into the base of the building. on the right, a smartphone with a stylized blue bird emerges from a swirling cloud of digital icons, embodying twitter blue's new features. the background is a gradient sky that shifts from day to night, illustrating the global nature of these tech giants' ventures. the elements intertwine seamlessly, creating a unified, dynamic composition that reflects the innovation and cross-cultural connectivity of these developments
